title: ICE with GAT + higher-ranked TAIT

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=79716e12fc3dad407ef9acb6d40392c1)

```rust
#![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)]
#![feature(generic_associated_types)]

pub trait Trait {
    type Assoc<'a>;
}

pub type Foo = impl for<'a> Trait<Assoc<'a> = FooAssoc<'a>>;
pub type FooAssoc<'a> = impl Sized;

struct Struct;
impl Trait for Struct {
    type Assoc<'a> = &'a u32;
}

const FOO: Foo = Struct;
```

```rust

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.63.0-nightly (42e1761c7 2022-05-15) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `FOO`
#1 [type_of] computing type of `Foo::{opaque#0}`
#2 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in top-level module
#3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
```
